cpu_version.description: Contains the version number of the CPU firmware.

cpu_revision.description: Contains the revision number of the CPU firmware.

system_config_code.description: This field defines the WorkHorse ADCP hardware configuration. Check RDI manual for details.

real_flag.description: This field is set by default as real data (0).

lag_length.description: The lag length is the time period between sound pulses. This is varied, and therefore of interest in, at a minimum, for the WM5, WM8 and WM11 and BM7 commands.

beams.description: Contains the number of beams used to calculate velocity data (not physical beams). The WorkHorse ADCP needs only three beams to calculate water-current velocities. The fourth beam provides an error velocity that determines data validity. If only three beams are available, the WorkHorse ADCP does not make this validity check.

cells.description: Contains the number of depth cells over which the WorkHorse ADCP collects data

pings.description: Contains the number of pings averaged together during a data ensemble (WP command). If WP = 0, the WorkHorse ADCP does not collect the WD water-profile data

depth_cell_len.description: Contains the length of one depth cell

blank_transmit.description: Contains the blanking distance used by the WorkHorse ADCP to allow the transmit circuits time to recover before the receive cycle begins (WF command).

signal_mode.description: Contains the Signal Processing Mode. This field will always be set to 1.

correlation_thresh.description: Contains the minimum threshold of correlation that water-profile data can have to be considered good data (WC command)

code_reps.description: Contains the number of code repetitions in the transmit pulse.

percent_good_min.description: Contains the minimum percentage of water-profiling pings in an ensemble that must be considered good to output velocity data.

error_velocity_thresh.description: This field, initially set by the WE command, contains the actual threshold value used to flag water-current data as good or bad. If the error velocity value exceeds this threshold, the WorkHorse ADCP flags all four beams of the affected bin as bad.

tp_minute.description: These fields, set by the TP command, contain the amount of time between ping groups in the ensemble. NOTE: The WorkHorse ADCP automatically extends the ensemble interval (set by TE) if (WP x TP > TE).

tp_second.description: These fields, set by the TP command, contain the amount of time between ping groups in the ensemble. NOTE: The WorkHorse ADCP automatically extends the ensemble interval (set by TE) if (WP x TP > TE).

tp_hundredth.description: Contains the minute portion of the WorkHorse ADCPâ€™s elapsed time measurement of the amount of time needed to complete the pinging of the current ensemble.

coord_transform_code.description: Contains the coordinate transformation processing parameters (EX command). These firmware switches indicate how the WorkHorse ADCP collected data.

head_alignment.description: Contains a correction factor for physical heading misalignment.

head_bias.description: Contains a correction factor for electrical/magnetic heading bias.

sensor_source_code.description: Contains the selected source of environmental sensor data (EZ command). These firmware switches indicate the following.

sensor_avail_code.description: This field reflects which sensors are available

bin_1_dist.description: This field contains the distance to the middle of the first depth cell (bin). This distance is a function of depth cell length (WS), the profiling mode (WM), the blank after transmit distance (WF), and speed of sound.

xmit_pulse_len.description: This field, set by the WT command, contains the length of the transmit pulse. When the WorkHorse ADCP receives a <BREAK> signal, it sets the transmit pulse length as close as possible to the depth cell length (WS command). This means the WorkHorse ADCP uses a WT command of zero. However, the WT field contains the actual length of the transmit pulse used.

ref_layer_avg.description: Contains the starting depth cell (LSB, byte 37) and the ending depth cell (MSB, byte 38) used for water reference layer averaging (WL command).

false_target_thresh.description: Contains the threshold value used to reject data received from a false target, usually fish.

spare_1.description: Contains the CX command setting. Range = 0 to 5

transmit_lag_dist.description: These fields contain the outputs of the Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) located on the DSP board. The ADC sequentially samples one of the eight channels per ping group (the number of ping groups per ensemble is the maximum of the WP). These fields are zeroed at the beginning of the deployment and updated each ensemble at the rate of one channel per ping group.

cpu_serial_no.description: Contains the serial number of the CPU board. The CPU Board Serial number is stored in Big Endian (MSB sent first).

system_bandwidth.description: Contains the WB command setting. Range = 0 to 1

system_power.description: Contains the CQ command setting for WorkHorse ADCP Monitor/Sentinel/Long Ranger ADCPs. Range 0 to 255.
